As an AI language model, here are some tips that you can consider to deal with a difficult coworker who constantly undermines your efforts and makes your job more challenging:

1. Stay calm and professional: Don't let your coworker's behavior affect your professionalism. Stay calm and focused on your work. Avoid getting into arguments or confrontations with them.

2. Document their behavior: Keeping a record of your coworker's actions can be helpful in discussions with your manager or HR representative. It can also help you to identify patterns in their behavior.

3. Communicate with them: Approach your coworker and ask to set up a meeting to discuss your concerns. Be diplomatic in your approach, and listen to their side of the story. Try to find common ground and work towards a resolution.

4. Seek support from your manager: If your coworker's behavior is causing you significant stress and impacting your ability to do your job, speak to your manager. Seek their advice on how to address the situation.

5. Focus on your strengths: Don't let your coworker's behavior undermine your confidence. Focus on your strengths, and continue to do your job to the best of your abilities.
